lead_paragraph: Under fire for four days, Afghan hospital staff members are short on food and medicine as Taliban and Afghan forces fight for the city.

byline.contributor: Zahra Nader and Fahim Abed contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and NAJIM RAHIM

headline.print_headline: Medics Hold the Line at an Afghan Hospital, Itself a Casualty
headline.main: A Few Medics Hold the Line in Kunduz, Their Hospital Also a Casualty

snippet: Under fire for four days, Afghan hospital staff members are short on food and medicine as Taliban and Afghan forces fight for the city....
abstract: Just two dozen doctors and nurses remain at only government hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, which is currently under siege by Taliban and deteriorating into humanitarian crisis; American airstrike accidentally destroyed Doctors Without Border facility during similar siege last year.
